snippet: “Corn Island,” Georgia’s entry for the foreign-language film Oscar, has few characters and little dialogue, so it seemed like production would not be difficult. Until the filmmakers realized that the setting needed to be created from scratch.
abstract: “Corn Island,” Georgia’s entry for the foreign-language film Oscar, has few characters and little dialogue, so it seemed like production would not be difficult. Until the filmmakers realized that the setting needed to be created from scratch.

headline.main: First Build an Island, Then Make a Film
